content:
Add Logic to Macros in Lightning Experience

To control the execution of macro instructions, add logic with the Macro Builder. Create expressions with one or more conditions, and add instructions that execute when the expression is true.

Available in: Lightning Experience, Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions.

User permissions needed:

* View macros: Read on macros
* Create and edit macros: Create AND Edit on macros
* Run irreversible macros: Manage Macros That Users Can't Undo

To add logic to a macro:

1. On a record page in a Lightning app, click Macros.
2. Click + or Create Macro.
3. Enter a name, description, folder, and select the object that the macro applies to.
4. Click Save.
5. Click Edit Instructions.
6. In the Macro Builder, click Add Logic.

An Expression Logic pane opens with an IF block. Add ELSE IF or ELSE blocks as needed. Configure conditions and instructions for each block.

For each condition:

* Use a field, operator, and comparison value.
* Select when to take action (All Conditions Are Met or Any Conditions Are Met).
* Add up to 30 conditions or groups in your expression.

When you're done, click Save. To test the macro, run it and view its execution.

Example:

IF [(Status equals New AND Priority equals High) OR (SLA Violation equals Yes)]
   {Send email with 'Case under Review: Gold' content}
ELSE IF (Status equals New AND Priority equals Medium)
   {Send email with 'Case under Review: Silver' content}
ELSE IF (Status equals New AND Priority equals Low)
   {Send email with 'Case under Review: Bronze' content}
title: Adding Logic to Macros in Lightning Experience
